props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Set Root Account Password Maximum Age

props.name: Parameter_Description_0
props.value: Maximum age of password in days for the root account

props.name: Parameter_Description_1
props.value: Minimum number of characters in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_2
props.value: Number of failed login attempts before account lockout

props.name: Parameter_Description_3
props.value: Interval for counting failed login attempts before account lockout

props.name: Parameter_Description_4
props.value: Seconds before automatic unlocking or permanently locking after excessive failed logins

props.name: Parameter_Description_5
props.value: Seconds before automatic unlocking or permanently locking after excessive failed logins

props.name: Parameter_Description_6
props.value: Specify the authselect profile to select

props.name: Parameter_Description_7
props.value: Specify the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords. Defines the value set as ENCRYPT_METHOD in /etc/login.defs.

props.name: Parameter_Description_8
props.value: Specify the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords. Defines the hashing algorithm to be used in pam_unix.so.

props.name: Parameter_Description_9
props.value: Minimum number of digits in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_10
props.value: Minimum number of lower case in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_11
props.value: Minimum number of categories of characters that must exist in a password

props.name: Parameter_Description_12
props.value: Minimum number of characters in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_13
props.value: Minimum number of other (special characters) in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_15
props.value: Minimum number of upper case in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_16
props.value: The last n passwords for each user are saved in <tt>/etc/security/opasswd</tt> in order to force password change history and keep the user from alternating between the same password too frequently.

props.name: Parameter_Description_17
props.value: Specify the number of rounds for the system password encryption algorithm. Defines the value set in <tt>/etc/pam.d/system-auth</tt> and <tt>/etc/pam.d/password-auth</tt>

props.value: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Length

props.value: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Lowercase Characters

props.value: Ensure All World-Writable Directories Are Owned by root User

props.value: Ensure All SUID Executables Are Authorized

props.value: Ensure All SGID Executables Are Authorized

props.value: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled for All dnf Package Repositories

props.value: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled In Main dnf Configuration

props.value: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled for Local Packages

props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Ensure Red Hat GPG Key Installed

props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Configure dnf-automatic to Install Available Updates Automatically

props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Configure dnf-automatic to Install Only Security Updates

props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Set number of Password Hashing Rounds - system-auth

props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Set number of Password Hashing Rounds - password-auth

props.name: Rule_Description
props.value: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Different Categories

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: The definition of unused user accounts is broad. It can include accounts whose owners don't use the system anymore, or users created by services or applications that should not be used. Automation by itself cannot discern which accounts are used or not.

implemented-requirements.description:
The rules selected below establish a general password strength baseline of 100 bits, based on the recommendations of the technical note "Recommandations relatives Ã  l'authentification multifacteur et aux mots de passe" (https://cyber.gouv.fr/publications/recommandations-relatives-lauthentification-multifacteur-et-aux-mots-de-passe)
The baseline should be reviewed and tailored to the system's use case and needs.

Only programs specifically designed to be used with setuid or setgid bits can have these privilege bits set. This requirement considers apropriate for setuid and setgid bits the binaries that are installed from recognized and authorized repositories (covered in R15). The remediation resets the sticky bit to intended value by vendor/developer, any finding after remediation should be reviewed.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is not possible to automatically decide in general way if a package is required or not for given system. As a future improvement, there could be rules assisting assessment by listing the installed packages.

implemented-requirements.description: It is not trivial to distinguish an official repository from an unofficial one. We cannot draw conclusions from the repo name or URL of the repo (as they can be arbitrary or behind a proxy). One approach to check the origin of installed packages is to check the signature of the packages. If the public key of a repository is not installed, the repo is not trusted.
Check the vendor CVE feed and configure automatic install of security related updates.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: Performing a minimal install is a good starting point, but doesn't provide any assurance over any package installed later. Manual review is required to assess if the installed services are minimal. In general, use of obsolete or insecure services is not recommended and we remove some of these in this recommendation.

implemented-requirements.description: The selection of rules doesn't cover the use of hardware devices to protect the passwords.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: Manual review is necessary to decide if the list of resident daemons is minimal. Assisting rules could be created to list sevices listening on the network for manual review.
